Installation#

Standalone Installation#

For installation, the pip package manager is recommended:

$ pip install xpot

Due to the fact that xpot is a wrapper around various ML potential fitting codes, you will need to install the fitting packages relevant for you.

Currently supported fitting codes: - pacemaker - FitSNAP - GAP

In order to fit potentials using any of these codes, you will need to install them in the same environment as xpot. All other dependencise will be installed automatically with xpot.

In order to test whether xpot has installed, you can run the following code in a python shell:

from xpot.loaders import load_defaults
from xpot.maths import get_rmse

defaults = load_defaults("/path/to/any/valid/json")
print(defaults)
test_list = [5, 5, 4]
print(get_rmse(test_list))

If the installation was successful, you should see the json file printed to console, as well as a return of 22 for the RMSE. To test the fitting codes, you will first need to install them, and then run the relevant jupyter notebooks included in the xpot repository.

ACE Functionality#

For ACE functionality, you need to install pacemaker. The package (and installation steps) are available at this link. The installation steps can be completed either before or after pip installation of xpot.

Warning

In our experience, it is required to run: pip install protobuf==3.20.*

after installation of pacemaker.

SNAP Functionality#

SNAP functionality is provided by the fitsnap package. The package (and installation steps) are available at this link. If not installing via pip you must use the following: export PYTHONPATH=/path/to/fitsnap:PYTHONPATH

SNAP functionality also requires LAMMPS to be installed. It must be compiled with ML_SNAP and PYTHON packages enabled. Steps are laid out in the fitsnap documentation, but also at the LAMMPS website.

GAP Functionality#

GAP functionality is provided by QUIP. The package (and installation steps) are available at this link.
